details.arabic_diacless: بارك اللٰه لك في الموهوب لك، وشكرت الواهب، وبلغ أشده، ورزقت بره
details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوْبِ لَكَ، وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ، وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ، وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ
details.transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka fil-mawhoobi laka, wa shakartal-waahiba, wa balagha 'ashuddahu, wa ruziqta birrahu.
details.translations: May Allah bless you with His gift to you, and may you (the new parent) give thanks, may the child reach the maturity of years, and may you be granted its righteousness. [1]

details.top: Reply of the parents would be:
details.arabic_diacless: بارك اللٰه لك وبارك عليك، وجزاك اللٰه خيرا، ورزقك اللٰه مثله، وأجزل ثوابك
details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللّٰهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَزَاكَ اللّٰهُ خَيْرًا، وَرَزَقَكَ اللّٰهُ مِثْلَهُ، وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ
details.transliteration: Baarakallahu laka wa baaraka 'alayka, wa jazaakallaahu khayran, wa razaqakallaahu mithlahu, wa 'ajzala thawaabaka.
details.translations: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and may Allah reward you well and bestow upon you its like and reward you abundantly". [2]
details.reference:
[1] This is menioned as a saying of Hasan Al basri Rahimullah. See tuhfatul maodud fi Ibn Qaiiyum, Page. 20, he connected this with Ibn Munzir's Al-Awsat
[2] An-Nawawi Al-Azkar Page. 349. Also see Sahih Azkar fil Nawawi, Salim al Hilali 2/713. For more details, read Az Zikr wa dua Wal Ilaj bir Ruqwa Page. 1/416

pageTitle: Congratulations on the occasion of a birth
